senses.de: to receive or take something offered

Tips.title: Offer Acceptance
Tips.description: Used when saying yes to something given or proposed.
Tips.example: When offered a scholarship, she quickly accepted it.

Tips.title: Polite Response
Tips.description: Shows willingness to receive or welcome what's offered, often out of politeness.
Tips.example: She accepted his invitation to dinner with a smile.

Tips.title: Acknowledging Apologies
Tips.description: Indicates forgiveness or understanding of an apology.
Tips.example: He accepted her apology, knowing everyone makes mistakes.

Tips.title: Consenting Decisions
Tips.description: Expresses agreement with a decision or arrangement.
Tips.example: She accepted the terms of the contract without any objections.

senses.de: to believe or come to recognize as valid or correct
senses.ex: He has finally accepted the truth.

Tips.title: Embracing Truth
Tips.description: Recognizing something as true, often reluctantly or after denial.
Tips.example: After the trial, he accepted the jury's verdict as the truth.

Tips.title: Acknowledging Reality
Tips.description: Admitting facts or reality, sometimes as a part of acceptance.
Tips.example: They had to accept the harsh realities of the business world.

senses.de: to endure a difficult or unpleasant situation
senses.ex: We have to accept the situation as it is.

Tips.title: Dealing with Difficulty
Tips.description: Indicates surrendering to situations beyond one's control.
Tips.example: In times of crisis, people learn to accept and adapt.

Tips.title: Tolerating Situations
Tips.description: Implies bearing situations without trying to change them.
Tips.example: You must accept certain delays when traveling.

senses.de: to regard as true or suitable

Tips.title: Accepting Opinions
Tips.description: Use it to show agreement with or acknowledgement of someone's views.
Tips.example: Though controversial, the professor accepted their hypothesis.

senses.de: to receive (a bill of exchange) or observe (a condition)

Tips.title: Financial Transactions
Tips.description: Used in banking or finance to acknowledge legal or financial instruments.
Tips.example: The cashier accepted the travelers' checks without hesitation.

Tips.title: Observing Conditions
Tips.description: Financial or legal context implying compliance with terms.
Tips.example: The company accepted all conditions laid out in the agreement.

Acknowledge.wordDefinition:
Acknowledge means to recognize or admit that something is true or real. For example, you can acknowledge a mistake you made, or acknowledge someone's hard work.

Accept is used when you want to take something or agree to something, while acknowledge is used when you want to admit something or give recognition to someone or something.

Approve.wordDefinition:
Approve means to give permission or to think that something is good or right. For example, if your parents approve of your choice of friends, they think that your friends are good people.

Accept is used when someone is simply receiving something, while approve is used when someone is giving permission or expressing a positive opinion.

Embrace.wordDefinition:
Embrace means to fully accept and welcome something or someone with open arms, or to adopt an idea or belief enthusiastically.

It's like saying "not only do I accept this, but I fully embrace and support it."

Each word is applicable in different contexts. You might accept the fact that you have to do chores, but you might embrace a new hobby or interest.

You might accept criticism from someone, but you might embrace a new friendship or relationship.

In short, accepting is more passive while embracing is more active and enthusiastic.

Endorse.wordDefinition:
Endorse means to publicly support or promote something. For example, a celebrity might endorse a product by appearing in an advertisement or by giving a positive review.

A politician might endorse a candidate by endorsing them in a speech or on social media.

Accept is focused on receiving or acknowledging something, while endorse is focused on supporting or promoting something.

Permit.wordDefinition:
Permit means to allow something to happen or be done. For example, your parents might permit you to go to a party if you promise to be home at a reasonable time.

Accept is used when talking about your own feelings or beliefs, while permit is used when talking about allowing or disallowing someone else's actions.

Receive.wordDefinition:
Both the words accept and receive mean to get or take something, but there is a slight difference between them.

Receive means to get or take something that is being given or delivered, whether you want it or not. For example, you receive a package from the mailman or receive a fine for breaking a traffic rule.

Accept denotes a willingness to take something while receive means something is simply delivered or given to you.

Recognize.wordDefinition: Recognize means to identify or acknowledge something or someone as familiar or known. It is applicable when someone identifies or acknowledges something, such as recognizing a friend at a distance or recognizing the importance of an achievement.

Support.wordDefinition:
Support means to actively help or promote something. This can be anything from lending emotional support to a friend going through a tough time, to actively campaigning for a political cause or social issue.

Essentially, accept means to acknowledge something without necessarily endorsing it, while support means actively aiding a cause or person.

Both words have their place depending on the situation - sometimes you might accept something you don't agree with, while other times you may actively support something you believe in.

Welcome.wordDefinition:
Welcome generally means to greet someone or something warmly, or to show hospitality. For example, if someone visits your house, you might welcome them in and offer them something to drink.

If you express your happiness or excitement for someone's arrival, you might also say "welcome!"

Accept is more about receiving or agreeing to something, while welcome is more about showing hospitality or greeting something/someone warmly.

quotes.Text: I like all types of women. I accept them as they are when they come into my life... But I'm not a romantic. I'm just up-front. I like to be a part of something real, not make-believe. I tell women to tell me the truth, to just lay it out. Let me be the judge and decide if I want you around or not. Let me have my choice.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Future

quotes.Text: Always fall in with what you're asked to accept. Take what is given, and make it over your way. My aim in life has always been to hold my own with whatever's going. Not against: with.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Robert Frost

quotes.Text: Each player must accept the cards life deals him or her: but once they are in hand, he or she alone must decide how to play the cards in order to win the game.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Voltaire

quotes.Text: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry; to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Maya Angelou

quotes.Text: God asks no man whether he will accept life. That is not the choice. You must take it. The only choice is how.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.Text: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joseph Campbell

quotes.Text: Until we accept the fact that life itself is founded in mystery, we shall learn nothing.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Henry Miller

quotes.Text: The key to life is accepting challenges. Once someone stops doing this, he's dead.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Bette Davis

quotes.Text: Accept the terrible responsibility of life with eyes wide open.
quotes.Title: Canadian Psychologist
quotes.Name: Jordan Peterson
